text:
(1) At the intersection of Fulton Street and Broadway, showing the mills of D. Jewell & son who dealt in flour, feed, and grain. This establishment was founded in 1857, as Bergen & Jewell, in 1861 it was Jewell & Voorhies. In 1862 it became D. Jewell & Son. Later William-son Electric Co. Inc., operated a battery factory at this place. In 1929 it became a gasoline station.

About 1905.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing also the B.M.T. Elevated line.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster collection.

(3) The same, showing Fulton Street, to its convergence with Broadway and East New York Ave. In the fenced in ground, was once the cottage of one Reid.

April 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
